free_text.Learning outcomes: Learn about oscillating motions and propagation of mechanical waves (including Rayleigh, Lamb and Love waves); presentation of the latter in the general framework of elasticity; completing the differential forms with the variational forms; developing coupling of waves, in particular acoustic/structure couplings; orienting the use of waves for characterizing materials.
free_text.Content: 1. Introduction[br/]2. General framework of linear elacticity: dynamical behavior and wave equations[br/]3. Advanced wave propagation: acoustic waves in fluids, wave propagation in structures, gravity and seismic waves (Rayleigh, Lamb, Love)[br/]4. Variational forms in dynamics: displacement and force formulations[br/]5. Wave interactions: coupling of waves and acoustic/structure interactions[br/]6. Materials and waves : characterization of mechanical properties[br/]
free_text.Note: Basic knowledge in "Eléments d'Acoustique Générale", V. Martin, PPUR, 2007[br/](http://www.ppur.org/livres/978-2-88074-654-4.html)
free_text.Required prior knowledge: The necessary elements of vector and tensor algebra and analysis are reviewed wherever the need arises.
